Guide to the Brooklyn league annual reports and publications
                    <num>ARC.159</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham

unittitle.value: Brooklyn League annual reports and publications

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn League collection, ARC.159, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown.

Membership to the Brooklyn League was open to any registered voter or taxpayer residing in Brooklyn upon election by the League's Membership Committee, and the payment of annual membership dues. Members of the Brooklyn League served on committees concerned with various civic and social issues in Brooklyn, including Education, Gas and Electricity, Municipal Ordinances, Legislation, Assessment and Taxation, etc. The Brooklyn League's headquarters was located in the Temple Bar Building at 44 Court Street in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn.

The Brooklyn League annual reports and publications measure 0.4 linear feet and span the dates 1902 to 1912. The collection includes annual reports for the years 1902, and 1905 to 1910. These reports feature summaries of the League's activities and accomplishments for each year, committee rosters, membership lists, and summaries of the League's financial standing for each year. Also included are a copy of the Brooklyn League's constitution, dated 1902, and printed pamphlets listing officers, committees and affiliated bodies, dated 1910 to 1912.
